subject: Education
title: Schema Theory: Learning Is Connecting
description: A short lesson to help you apply Schema Theory: Learning Is Connecting.

hook.text: Tell a child 'democracy' and they're lost. Say 'classroom voting' and they get it.

buildup.text: Schemas are mental frameworks built from prior experience.

discovery.text: New info that hooks into an existing schema is encoded faster and remembered longer.

twist.text: Wrong schemas cause misconceptionsâ€”sometimes you must break one to build another.

climax.text: Great teaching activates the right schema before introducing new material.

quiz.question: What role do schemas play in learning?
options: They provide frameworks that help integrate new information
They replace the need for working memory
